name: 陳怡倩
objective: This course is designed to engage students in intensive study and analysis of selected issues and problems in second language acquisition. The topics covered in this course include, but are not limited to, the following: language aptitude, cross-linguistic influences, personality, motivation, leaning styles, learning strategies, language anxiety, and learners' beliefs.
schedule:
1	Course introduction
2	First & second language acquisition I
3	First & second language acquisition II
4	Language Learning Context
5	Age
6	Theoretical perspectives I
7	Theoretical perspectives II
8	Mid-term
9	Review of mid-term
10	Learner language
11	Foreign language aptitude
12	Motivation I
13	Motivation II
14	Affect & individual differences
15	Teaching approaches & instruction
16	TBA
17	Final exam
18	Review of final exam
scorePolicy: Active class participation & activities (25%); mid-term exam (35%); final exam (40%)
materials:
Hummel, Kirsten M. (2014). Introducing second language acquisition: Perspective and practices. Malden, MA: Wiley Blackwell.
Ortega, Lourdes. (2009). Understanding second language acquisition. London, UK: Hodder.
